hours_text:
##  Visit

##### **Museum Hours**

Tuesday–Wednesday 10 AM–5 PM  
Thursday 10 AM–7 PM  
Friday–Saturday 10 AM–5 PM  
Sunday 12 PM–5 PM  
Monday Closed

##### **Admission is free.**  
  
**Holiday Closures**

Sheldon is closed on these holidays: New Year’s Day, Easter Sunday, Memorial Day, Fourth of July, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day.  

##### **Accessible Entrance and Parking**

There is barrier-free ramp access to the museum from the parking lot on the north side of the building. A wheelchair is available free of charge, on a first-come, first-served basis.

  * A limited number of free parking spaces are available in a lot on the north side of the building. To use this lot, please give your license plate number to a Sheldon visitor experience associate when you enter the building. [**Written directions to this lot can be found here.**](https://sheldonartmuseum.org/parking)
  * Like other parking lots on campus, Sheldon's lot is not available on the days of home football games. For information about parking and facilities on football game days visit [**huskers.com/football-game-day-information**](https://huskers.com/football-game-day-information).
  * Bicycle parking is available near Louis Pound Hall, across the sidewalk on the east side of Sheldon.

Additional information about vehicle and bicycle parking on campus can be explored on the university's [**interactive map**](https://maps.unl.edu/SHEL).

For additional information, please call ...

accessibility_text:
##  Admission, Hours, and Accessible Entrance

##### **Museum Hours**

Tuesday–Wednesday 10 AM–5 PM  
Thursday 10 AM–7 PM  
Friday–Saturday 10 AM–5 PM  
Sunday 12 PM–5 PM  
Monday Closed

##### **Admission is free.**  
  
**Holiday Closures**

Sheldon is closed on these holidays: New Year’s Day, Easter Sunday, Memorial Day, Fourth of July, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day.

##### **Accessible Entrance and Parking**

There is barrier-free ramp access to the museum from the parking lot on the north side of the building. A wheelchair is available free of charge, on a first-come, first-served basis.

  * On-street, metered parking is available during the day in most of downtown Lincoln.
  * A limited number of free parking spaces are available in a lot on the north side of the building. To use this lot, please give your license plate number to a Sheldon visitor experience associate when you enter the building. [**Written directions to this lot can be found here.**](https://sheldonartmuseum.org/parking)
  * Like other parking lots on campus, Sheldon's lot is not available on the days of home football games. For information about parking and facilities on football game days visit [**huskers.com/football-game-day-information**](https://huskers.com/football-game-day-information).
  * Bicycle parking is available near Louis Pound Hall, across the sidewalk on the east side of Sheldon.

collections_text:
# Featured Exhibition

##  [ Collection Galleries  ](/exhibitions/collection-galleries-2024-25/)

August 15, 2024 through December 31, 2027

Sheldon Museum of Art’s collection galleries are reimagined through installations that spark inquiry and dialogue on topics that transcend time, place, and media. The themes they present emphasize human ingenuity, imagination, and our interconnectedness with one another and our surroundings.
